newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hanny, Ritek in US$24 mln deal.
newsitem.headline: Hanny, Ritek in US$24 mln deal.

text.p: Optical discs maker Hanny Holdings Ltd said on Thursday it had agreed to sell 10 percent of Memtek International Inc to independent third party Ritek Inc for US$24 million.
Hanny owned 88 percent of Memtek before the deal, which involves the sale of 100,000 of its unit's existing shares to the Taiwanese company.
Memtek holds Hanny's worldwide distribution network for compact discs and other audio and video products, the statement said.
Hanny said the proceeds would be used as general working capital and the disposal was expected to give rise to a gain of HK$170 million over the book value of the shares sold.
In February, the British Trade Commission in Hong Kong announced that Hanny and Ritek were planning to form a HK$203.11 million joint venture to manufacture optical discs in Northern Ireland.
